docs.lead_paragraph: Operators of a northeast Ohio bridal shop linked to an Ebola survivor say the store is closing because it lost significant business and has been stigmatized.

headline.main: Ohio Bridal Store Linked to Ebola Survivor Is Closing
headline.print_headline: Ohio Bridal Store Linked to Ebola Survivor Is Closing

docs.snippet: Operators of a northeast Ohio bridal shop linked to an Ebola survivor say the store is closing because it lost significant business and has been stigmatized.

docs.lead_paragraph: In command and ready for a fight, defiant Republicans ignored two White House veto threats and advanced bills in Congress Thursday curbing President Barack Obama's cherished health care overhaul and forcing construction on a proposed oil pipeline. The top House Democrat predicted her party would uphold both vetoes.

headline.main: GOP Congress Moves Veto-Bait Bills on Health Care, Pipeline
headline.print_headline: GOP Congress Moves Veto-Bait Bills on Health Care, Pipeline

docs.snippet: In command and ready for a fight, defiant Republicans ignored two White House veto threats and advanced bills in Congress Thursday curbing President Barack Obama's cherished health care overhaul and forcing construction on a proposed oil pipeline....

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government opted to automatically re-enroll health insurance customers at the end of 2014; Rhode Island decided to make them shop again.

headline.main: A Rhode Island Rule on Health Enrollment Offers a Consumer Experiment
headline.print_headline: In Rhode Island, a Test of Health Consumer Behavior

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Rhode Island is requiring residents to shop for health insurance in its marketplace in 2015, diverging from federal government's plan to automatically re-enroll customers; nationally, 35 to 40 percent of 2014 health care consumers came back to HealthCare.gov to shop, while in Rhode Island figure was 78 percent.
docs.snippet: The federal government opted to automatically re-enroll health insurance customers at the end of 2014; Rhode Island decided to make them shop again.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: In part because of wage stagnation, even smaller rises in health care costs are less affordable, a study by the Commonwealth Fund said.

headline.main: Health Premiums Rise More Slowly, but Workers Shoulder More of Cost
headline.print_headline: Health Premiums Rise More Slowly, but Workers Shoulder More of Cost

docs.abstract: Commonwealth Fund analyzes health care costs across states and finds workers with employee-sponsored health insurance are paying more for health care even as premium price increases have slowed; trend combined with stagnation of incomes results in heavier burden for workers.
docs.snippet: In part because of wage stagnation, even smaller rises in health care costs are less affordable, a study by the Commonwealth Fund said.
